intro: Kyllinga multinervia, commonly known as the slender kyllinga, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences with tiny, spikelet-like flowers. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Kyllinga multinervia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
